title: Intensive Short-Term Course on Digital Interaction-Enhanced Mathematics Educational Content Design (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and proficiency in using digital devices
context.additional_context: Learners participate in real-time online classes via personal devices and undertake digital interactive content creation projects in a blended learning environment.

learning_goals: Digital interactive content for math education can be designed by applying the four stages (planning, design, production, evaluation) of the ADIC model.
Learners can collaboratively create interactive content with up to 5 team members using Zoom-based real-time collaboration tools.
Learners can implement gamified mathematical concept visualization content using HTML5/CANVA tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
